programme.title: Roll, Thunder, Roll
programme.desc: Red Ryder (Jim Bannon) and Little Beaver (Don Kay Reynolds) help a Mexican Robin Hood framed by raiders.

programme.title: Ridin' the Lone Trail
programme.desc: A cowboy (Bob Steele) clears a woman rancher (Claire Rochelle) suspected of robbery.

programme.title: A Lust to Kill
programme.desc: A marshal (Jim Davis) uses an outlaw's (Don Megowan) girlfriend (Allison Hayes) as bait to lure him into a showdown.

programme.title: Law of the Pampas
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) and his sidekick (Russell Hayden) head for South America to deliver cattle.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat & Stoney seek missing government gold hidden in Ozarks.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Outlaw gangs are stealing gold from Chinese miners and driving them off of their claims.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Betty Jo becomes the first female contestant in the horseshoe tournament.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate decides it is time for Betty Jo to put down the books and set out to find a significant other.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: After being wrongfully jailed on a murder charge, Cisco and Pancho escape to capture the real murderer.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco is challenged by a man who seeks revenge after being jailed.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Despite their position under cover as members of the infamous Quantrill gang, Matt and Frankie cannot stop them from carrying out a vicious massacre in Lawrence, Kan.; Matt sets out to hunt down Quantrill for what happened.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie investigate a woman's suspicious cattle ranch amid a crisis threatening competing ranches in Sweetwater, Wyo.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Sheriff Blade arrives from Comstock to arrest rancher Del Randall on what appears to the Judge in trumped-up charges; Bean and Taggart put Del in jail for safety while they investigate.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: A young man is accused of murder; he makes a run for it.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A young doctor (David Alpert) faces a moral dilemma when asked to treat the escaped convict (Gregg Barton) who killed his father (Stanley Andrews).

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: An injured rancher summons all his strength to help Annie and Lofty when outlaws hold his wife hostage.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Ethan Allen and the Green Mountain Boys are at war with the ruthless tax collectors, a bunch of outlaws, more Robin Hood than the Dalton gang; when the authorities start to pin their misdeeds on them, Hawkeye must sort it out.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Someone is going to a lot of trouble to convince the townspeople that a witch has cursed them.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss' bandit uncle (Neville Brand) decides to bypass the Ponderosa, but his gang disagrees.

programme.title: Wildfire
programme.desc: Two horse-traders (Bob Steele, Sterling Holloway) find their problem is a rustler (John Miljan), not a wild horse.

programme.title: Boots and Saddles
programme.desc: A singing ranch foreman and his sidekick convince a young British nobleman to keep, rather than sell, the ranch left to him by his late father.

programme.title: Heart of the Golden West
programme.desc: Roy sidesteps crooked shipping agents by herding Cherokee City's cattle aboard a steamboat bound for market.

programme.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
programme.desc: An Army agent (Ronald Reagan) rides with a Texan (Barbara Stanwyck) trying to drive her father's cattle through rough territory.

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: A baseball star (Lou Gehrig) goes west with his sister (Evalyn Knapp) and helps a lawyer (Smith Ballew) bust a cattle-protection racket.

programme.title: The Trail Beyond
programme.desc: Rod Drew (John Wayne) is asked to search for missing people in Canada, and quickly finds out a gang of French Canadian outlaws have been kidnapping people.

programme.title: American Empire
programme.desc: Three men (Richard Dix, Leo Carrillo, Preston Foster) start a big cattle ranch in post-Civil War Texas, but greed destroys it.

programme.title: Riders of the Deadline
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) and his pals (Andy Clyde, Jimmy Rogers) get the drop on Mexican-border gunrunners.

programme.title: Raiders of Red Gap
programme.desc: The Lone Rider (Bob Livingston) and his sidekick (Al "Fuzzy" St. John) crunch an Arizona grazing-land monopoly.

programme.title: The Diamond Trail
programme.desc: A New York reporter (Rex Bell) follows a gang of gem smugglers west.
